ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Department of Employment Affairs and Social Protection
ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ADDRESS: Shannon Lodge, Carrick on Shannon, Co Leitrim
ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: For the attention of: Michelle ODonnell

CONTENTS.P: Yderligere supplerende oplysninger
Need for additional works, services or supplies by the original contractor /concessionaire (Art. 72(1)(b) of Directive 2014/24/EU).
Description of the economic or technical reasons and the inconvenience or duplication of cost preventing a change of contractor:

The need for the contract modification arises because until the end of the Summer 2017, there was of a lack of certainty on what the future take-up of the SAFE/PSC/MyGovID infrastructure would be. It would be uneconomic and cause significant inconvenience to the programme for the production, personalization and distribution of public service cards if a new contractor had to be procured during the interim period pending the commencement of a future contract in response to the anticipated RFT noted in section II.2.7 above. It would cost significantly less to continue the current service with the existing contractor than to tender for a different contractor for an interim period pending the award of a new contract. A change of contractor for this interim period would result in significant inconvenience due to the temporary disruption of service pending the appointment of a new contractor.

The contracting authority expects that it will take a new contractor, to be appointed pursuant to the RFT noted in section II.2.7 above, between eight and ten months to become operational. The purpose of this modification is to allow the continuation of the service for the intervening period until the new contract is operational.
Duration in month:

The modified contract will commence on the 1.1.2018 and will run until the 31.12.2018 at the latest. By the end of 2018 it is anticipated that a new contract for the production, personalization and distribution of public service cards will have been awarded pursuant to an RFT to be published in early 2018 in the OJEU.

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: For the attention of: Michelle ODonnell

Need for additional works, services or supplies by the original contractor /concessionaire (Art. 72(1)(b) of Directive 2014/24/EU).
Description of the economic or technical reasons and the inconvenience or duplication of cost preventing a change of contractor:

The need for the contract modification arises because until the end of the Summer 2017, there was of a lack of certainty on what the future take-up of the SAFE/PSC/MyGovID infrastructure would be. It would be uneconomic and cause significant inconvenience to the programme for the production, personalization and distribution of public service cards if a new contractor had to be procured during the interim period pending the commencement of a future contract in response to the anticipated RFT noted in section II.2.7 above. It would cost significantly less to continue the current service with the existing contractor than to tender for a different contractor for an interim period pending the award of a new contract. A change of contractor for this interim period would result in significant inconvenience due to the temporary disruption of service pending the appointment of a new contractor.

The contracting authority expects that it will take a new contractor, to be appointed pursuant to the RFT noted in section II.2.7 above, between eight and ten months to become operational. The purpose of this modification is to allow the continuation of the service for the intervening period until the new contract is operational.
Duration in month:

The modified contract will commence on the 1.1.2018 and will run until the 31.12.2018 at the latest. By the end of 2018 it is anticipated that a new contract for the production, personalization and distribution of public service cards will have been awarded pursuant to an RFT to be published in early 2018 in the OJEU.
